approval_data.project_name: V-KYC recordings to be fetched for Audit requirements
approval_data.project_summary: This project aims to develop a self-service portal/dashboard for the VKYC team to easily fetch V-KYC recordings for audit and internal requirements. Currently, this process involves manual requests to the IT data server team. The new system will provide direct access to approved PL-VKYC case recordings, allowing search by date, month, year, and LAN ID, as well as supporting bulk download capabilities.
project_goals: To provide a self-service portal for VKYC team leads and process managers to fetch V-KYC recordings.
To eliminate the manual request process for VKYC recording retrieval from the IT data server team.
To make VKYC recordings readily available and easily accessible for audit and internal requirements.
approval_data.business_context: Currently, the VKYC team relies on manual requests to the IT data server team to retrieve VKYC recordings stored on the LTF 'NFS (Network File System)' server. This manual process is inefficient and time-consuming, particularly when responding to internal and external audit requirements. There is a critical need for a streamlined, self-service mechanism to access these recordings directly.

requirements.description: The system shall provide a web-based portal/dashboard for VKYC recording access.
The portal shall provide access to VKYC process leads (Team Leaders & Process Managers).
The portal shall make all approved PL-VKYC recordings available.
Users shall be able to search for recordings by date, month, and year.
Users shall be able to search for recordings by LAN ID.
The portal shall provide an option for users to upload an Excel or text file containing a list of LAN IDs for bulk video download.
The uploaded file for bulk download shall contain a minimum of 2 and a maximum of 50 LAN IDs.
The uploaded file for bulk download shall be in CSV or TXT format.
Upon file upload, the system shall trigger a call to a backend API to process the bulk request.
The system shall display the results of the bulk request in a tabular format on the screen.
The displayed results table shall include a 'Download All' option.
The displayed results table shall implement pagination, showing only 10 records at a time.
The 'Download All' option shall download records in batches of 10 at a time.
Clicking on a specific LAN ID in the results shall initiate the download of the corresponding recording.
Access to the bulk video download screen shall be restricted to Team Leaders.

functional_requirements: The system shall provide a web-based portal/dashboard for VKYC recording access.
The portal shall provide access to VKYC process leads (Team Leaders & Process Managers).
The portal shall make all approved PL-VKYC recordings available.
Users shall be able to search for recordings by date, month, and year.
Users shall be able to search for recordings by LAN ID.
The portal shall provide an option for users to upload an Excel or text file containing a list of LAN IDs for bulk video download.
The uploaded file for bulk download shall contain a minimum of 2 and a maximum of 50 LAN IDs.
The uploaded file for bulk download shall be in CSV or TXT format.
Upon file upload, the system shall trigger a call to a backend API to process the bulk request.
The system shall display the results of the bulk request in a tabular format on the screen.
The displayed results table shall include a 'Download All' option.
The displayed results table shall implement pagination, showing only 10 records at a time.
The 'Download All' option shall download records in batches of 10 at a time.
Clicking on a specific LAN ID in the results shall initiate the download of the corresponding recording.

non_functional_requirements: The system shall ensure that only authorized VKYC Team Leads and Process Managers can access the portal (Security).
The system shall ensure that the bulk video download screen is accessible only to Team Leaders (Security).
The system should provide a responsive user interface for searching and downloading recordings (Usability/Performance - implied).
The system should maintain the confidentiality and integrity of VKYC recordings (Security - implied).
stakeholders: IT Data Server Team (Current process owner, potential integration partner)
success_criteria: VKYC Team Leads and Process Managers can independently fetch V-KYC recordings via the portal without manual IT intervention.
The portal successfully provides search capabilities for VKYC recordings by date, month, year, and LAN ID.
Users can successfully upload a file with a list of LAN IDs (2-50) and initiate bulk video download requests.
The system accurately processes bulk requests and allows for the download of corresponding VKYC videos.
Access to the portal and specific features (like bulk download) is correctly restricted to authorized personnel (Team Leads, Process Managers).
constraints: Maximum 50 LAN IDs allowed per bulk upload file.
Minimum 2 LAN IDs required per bulk upload file.
Bulk upload file format must be CSV or TXT.
Table pagination displays only 10 records at a time.
Bulk download functionality downloads records in batches of 10 at a time.
VKYC recordings are currently stored on LTF ‘NFS (Network File System)’ server.
The project is classified as a Change Request.
assumptions: The LTF ‘NFS (Network File System)’ server will continue to store VKYC recordings and be accessible to the new portal/backend API.
A backend API capable of retrieving VKYC recordings from the NFS server based on LAN IDs and dates exists or can be developed.
LAN IDs are unique identifiers for VKYC cases and can be used to retrieve specific recordings.
The VKYC recordings are in a standard, downloadable format.
The 'Approved PL-VKYC cases' are clearly identifiable and their associated recordings are accessible.
The necessary infrastructure for hosting the portal and API is available.
risks: Data Security: Risk of unauthorized access to sensitive VKYC recordings if access controls are not robust.
Performance Issues: Potential for slow retrieval or download times, especially for large video files or high concurrent usage, given the 10-record download limit.
Integration Complexity: Challenges in integrating the new portal/API with the existing NFS server and ensuring reliable data transfer.
Data Integrity: Risk of incomplete or corrupted video downloads.
Scalability: The system might face performance degradation if the volume of VKYC cases or audit requests significantly increases beyond anticipated levels.
User Adoption: Resistance from VKYC leads/managers to adopt the new portal if it's not user-friendly or reliable.

domain_specific_details.V-KYC: Video Know Your Customer process, a method of customer identification using video interaction.
domain_specific_details.PL-VKYC cases: Personal Loan Video Know Your Customer cases, indicating the specific type of VKYC recordings relevant to personal loans.
domain_specific_details.LAN ID: Likely refers to Loan Account Number or a similar unique identifier used to tag and retrieve specific customer cases/recordings.
domain_specific_details.NFS (Network File System) server: An existing centralized file storage system where VKYC recordings are currently stored.
domain_specific_details.Audit requirements: The primary business driver for the project, necessitating easy and verifiable access to historical VKYC recordings.

recommendations: Define explicit non-functional requirements, including specific performance metrics (e.g., maximum download time for a single video, response time for search queries), scalability targets, and detailed security protocols (e.g., encryption, access logging, vulnerability testing).
Clarify error handling mechanisms for file uploads, API calls, and failed downloads, including user notifications.
Specify data retention policies for VKYC recordings accessible via the portal.
Detail the exact behavior of the 'Download All' option, especially for scenarios where more than 10 records are displayed (e.g., does it download multiple batches, or require multiple clicks?).
Provide mockups or wireframes for the portal beyond the basic table structure to enhance clarity on user experience.
Define specific business test scenarios to ensure all functional requirements are met.
Clarify the purpose and usage of 'Date for cross checking the V-KKYC approved date (for IT usage)'.

identified_gaps: Lack of detailed Non-Functional Requirements (Performance, Scalability, Reliability, Maintainability).
No specifications for error handling and user feedback in case of failed uploads or downloads.
No details on data retention policies for the VKYC recordings on the portal.
Absence of specific security measures beyond basic access control (e.g., data encryption, vulnerability testing, audit trails for portal usage).
No explicit reporting requirements specified, despite the project being driven by 'Audit requirements'.
No clear definition of how historical VKYC recordings will be migrated or made available on the new portal.
No details on the technology stack for the portal or backend API.
Ambiguity regarding the 'Download All' functionality for more than 10 records (e.g., single zip file of all, or sequential batches).
recommendations_for_completion: Conduct workshops with stakeholders to define comprehensive NFRs, including specific performance benchmarks for video retrieval and download, and system uptime requirements.
Develop detailed specifications for error handling, user notifications, and logging mechanisms.
Establish clear data retention and archival policies for the VKYC recordings accessible through the portal.
Elaborate on security requirements, including data encryption (in transit and at rest), robust access logging, and plans for regular security audits.
Re-evaluate if any reporting capabilities are needed for audit purposes, even if basic usage statistics or download logs.
Define the strategy and process for making existing VKYC recordings available and searchable on the new portal.
Specify the proposed technical architecture and chosen technologies for the portal and API development.
Clarify the user experience for downloading more than 10 records at once with the 'Download All' option.
